channel.title: Teleports
channel.description: how can i make a custom teleport and where do i put it

item.title: Teleports
item.dc:creator: @Mercifies Mercifies
item.description:
@Mercifies wrote:

Okay then… Here is a step-by-step tutorial then. NOTE: It is easy if you follow along but contains a bit of info.

  1. Open client.java

  2. Search (Ctrl+F)

home")
  1. Add this code in a new break.

case 9999: teleportToX = XCOORD; teleportToY = YCOORD; sendMessage("You teleport to..."); break;
XCOORD is the X Coordinate and YCOORD is the Y Coordinate

  1. Then, scroll back to the top and click on something to make sure that it is recognizing that you are at the top and Search
        makeGlobalObject(

5a. Add the code

        makeGlobalObject(XCOORD, YCOORD, ID, POS, 10); // Portal name to make it easier to access

5b. I will break this down for you…

[ul][li]XCOORD - The X Coordinate[/li]
[li]YCOORD - The Y Coordiante[/li]
[li]ID - The object ID (You can find Portal ID’s below)[/li]
[li]POS - The position it is facing (-2, -1, 0, 1)[/li]
[li]10 - Is there for everything, just go with it[/li]
[li]// - Description of the portal in case you want to come back to it and change something (Home portal, etc)[/li][/ul]

  1. If don’t know any portal ID’s, here are some:

ID Name
1812 Portal
2156 Magic Portal
2157 Magic Portal
2158 Magic Portal
2465 Portal
2466 Portal
2467 Portal
2468 Portal
2469 Portal
2470 Portal
2471 Portal
2472 Portal
2473 Portal
2474 Portal
2475 Portal
2476 Portal
2477 Portal
2492 Portal
2880 Mystic portal
4150 Portal
4151 Portal
4152 Portal
4153 Portal
4154 Portal
4155 Portal
4156 Portal
4157 Portal
4387 Saradomin Portal
4388 Zamorak Portal
4389 Portal
4390 Portal
4406 Portal
4407 Portal
4408 Guthix Portal
6282 Portal
6551 Portal
7272 Portal
7273 Portal
7288 Portal
7289 Portal
7315 Portal
7316 Portal
7318 Portal
7319 Portal
7321 Portal
7322 Portal
7324 Portal
7325 Portal
7352 Portal
7353 Portal
8972 Portal
8987 Portal

—OPTIONAL—

If you want to add this to the tool bar tab (where the emotions things are kept, follow along)

  1. Open TextHandler.java

  2. Scroll down until you start seeing names of places you can teleport (Train, pkbox, etc)

  3. In the next empty sendframe case replace it with:

        p.sendFrame126("PLACE", 9999);
  1. Save, compile, done!

@surfer25 wrote:

teleportToX = xxxx;
teleportToY = yyyy;

Replace the values with your teleporting coordinates obviously.
